memberdef.name: ArrayND

detaileddescription.para:
a_p
Pointer to data.
a_begin
Start index (inclusive).
a_end
End index (exclusive).
This constructor specifies begin and end indices using IntVectND<N> for all N dimensions.

memberdef.name: ArrayND

detaileddescription.para:
a_p
Pointer to data.
a_begin
Start index.
a_end
End index exclusive.
a_ncomp
Number of components (4th dimension).
Typically used for standard (i, j, k, n) access in 3D simulations.

briefdescription.para: Reduced dimension constructor with component count.

detaileddescription.para:
a_p
Pointer to data.
a_begin
Start index (inclusive).
a_end
End index (exclusive).
ncomp
Number of components (size of last dimension).
Pads intermediate dimensions with [0,1) and sets the last dimension to [0, ncomp).

memberdef.name: ArrayND

detaileddescription.para:
rhs
The source ArrayND to slice from.
start_comp
The starting component index for the slice.
Creates a new ArrayND that is a slice of the input ArrayND along the last dimension (components).

detaileddescription.para:
rhs
The source ArrayND to slice from.
start_comp

memberdef.definition: __host__ __device__ constexpr amrex::ArrayND< T, N, last_dim_component >::operator bool
memberdef.name: operator bool

briefdescription.para: Check if the ArrayND pointer is valid.

simplesect.para: true if pointer is valid, false otherwise.

memberdef.definition: __host__ __device__ constexpr bool amrex::ArrayND< T, N, last_dim_component >::ok
memberdef.name: ok

briefdescription.para: Check if the ArrayND pointer is valid and bounds are valid.

simplesect.para: true if pointer and bounds are valid, false otherwise.

param.type: std::enable_if_t<!std::is_void_v< U > &&!IsArray4_v &&detail::ArrayNDIndexCheck_impl_v< N, last_dim_component, idx... >, int >

detaileddescription.para:
idx
Variadic template for indices.
i
Variadic list of indices.
Reference to the element.
This operator is only enabled when the number of indices provided matches the dimension N or N-1 if last_dim_component is true, where in the latter case the last dimension is assumed to be 0. The passed indices must be of integral types that can be converted to int without narrowing. The last index can also be an enum type.
TODO: Use concepts when we move to C++20.

M
The dimension of the index vector.
iv
The index vector.
Reference to the element.
This function handles access via:
Full dimension vector (M == N).
Spatial dimension vector (M == N-1) && !IsArray4_v (only enabled if last_dim_component is true).

memberdef.argsstring: (IntVectND< M > const &iv, int n) const noexcept
memberdef.name: operator()

briefdescription.para: Access element by spatial IntVectND and component index.

detaileddescription.para:
M
The dimension of the spatial index vector (typically N-1 or AMREX_SPACEDIM).
iv
The spatial index vector.
n
Component index (last dimension).
Reference to the element.
This overload is enabled only when last_dim_component is true and M represents the spatial dimensions (either N-1 or AMREX_SPACEDIM).

param.type: std::enable_if_t<!std::is_void_v< U > &&!IsArray4_v &&detail::ArrayNDIndexCheck_impl_v< N, last_dim_component, idx... >, int >

memberdef.definition: __host__ __device__ constexpr void amrex::ArrayND< T, N, last_dim_component >::set_stride
memberdef.name: set_stride

detaileddescription.para:
T
The type of data (e.g., Real, int).
N
The dimension of the array (rank).
last_dim_component
If true, the last dimension is treated as components.
ArrayND is a lightweight, non-owning wrapper around a pointer that provides multidimensional indexing into a contiguous memory block. It is trivially copyable and designed to be passed by value into GPU kernels. Note, ArrayND follows fortran-style column-major ordering.
It stores the pointer, stride information, and the bounds (begin and end) of the array.
